page.title: 17THE ARNCLIFFE ESTATE
page.content: The Lindley Park estate, more commonly known as the{Arncliffe {Estate,}is just a few steps away from the busy New Hey Road. It was begun to be built in the mid 1970's and finished in 1981, although the latest addition was completed in 1984. To one side of the estate is Low Hills Field which is owned by a farmer who lives in{The Gatehouse,}an old house which is about 200 years old. There is a network of blocked wells, all connected by tunnels which lead to a small marshy pond in the centre of the field. The other side of the estate is more industrial; there is{Highfield Funeral {Services}factory where coffins are manufactured and further down the road is the{Wellington Cloth Mill,}opened in the 1800's.
